        FactBase Consulting Limited is a medium-sized and professionally-run HR consulting firm in Lagos with a keen interest in developing young, brilliant, diligent and honest graduates to become HRM professionals starting as Management Trainees [HRM].

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Manager (C02)

Employment Type: Full-time

title: Job Openings at TNL Pharmaceuticals
content:
TNL Pharmaceuticals is one of the leading pharmaceutical company in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Demand Generation Manager

Job Locations: Abuja & Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Demand Generation Manager drives product awareness and sales growth through marketing campaigns, customer engagement, and data-driven strategies.


Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop and execute demand generation and marketing campaigns.
	Collaborate with sales teams to increase product uptake.
	Conduct market research and analyze campaign performance.
	Ensure all marketing activities comply with regulatory standards.
	Manage budgets, monitor results, and report performance to management.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Pharmacy, Marketing, or a related field (MBA preferred).
	2 - 4 years of relevant experience in pharmaceuticals.
	Strong marketing and analytical skills.
	Good understanding of pharmaceutical markets.
	Excellent communication, planning, and team coordination skills.
	Creativity and ability to deliver measurable results.


Application Closing Date: 18th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV to: tnlrecruitment01@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Regional Sales Manager

Job Locations: Abuja (FCT) & Igando, Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Coordinate sales activities within the region to achieve the agreed sales budgeted value on a monthly basis in line with the company’s objectives and procedures
	Build and maintain relationships with distributors, prescribers, and other stakeholders, ensuring customer satisfaction and business retention.
	Develop targeted sales strategies, collaborate with the marketing team, and support promotional efforts through presentations, trade shows, and events.
	Collaborate with internal teams to develop and execute sales strategies and marketing campaigns
	Educate customers on product features, benefits and usage guidelines
	Monitor sales performance and track progress against targets
	Work strategically to increase awareness and use of the company’s products.
	Demonstrable experience managing a sales team of at least 10 members
	Strong hospital and ethical brand marketing experience
	Self-directed and results-oriented with excellent problem-solving skills.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 2 - 3 years of experience.


Salary
N150,000 - N300,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 20th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV and cover letter to: tnlrecruitment01@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Medical Sales Representative

Job Locations: Igando - Lagos, Benue, Delta, Edo, Gombe and Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Medical Sales Representative to promote and sell our healthcare products.
	The ideal candidate will have strong sales acumen, healthcare product knowledge, and the ability to build relationships with healthcare professionals, hospitals and pharmacies.


Key Responsibilities


	Promote and sell health care products to hospitals, pharmacies, clinics, and distributor outlets.
	Develop and maintain strong relationships with healthcare professionals including doctors, pharmacists, nurses, and purchasing managers.
	Conduct product presentations and training sessions for healthcare personnel and distributors.
	Achieve monthly, quarterly, and annual sales targets in assigned territory.
	Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and customer feedback to recommend strategic actions.
	Maintain accurate records of customer interactions, sales, and inventory.
	Ensure compliance with regulatory and ethical standards of pharmaceutical/healthcare sales.
	Participate in trade shows, medical exhibitions, and promotional events.
	Provide after-sales support and resolve customer issues efficiently.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 2 - 3 years of experience.


Application Closing Date: 20th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV to: tnlrecruitment01@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Job Vacancies at CIG Motors Company Limited
content:
CIG Motors Company Limited is one of the African subsidiaries of Choice International Group. We are the exclusive premiere representative of leading Chinese automotive giants, including GAC Motors, JMC Motors, Dongfeng Motors, FAW Group, and Wuling Motors, within the Nigeria and Africa market.

CIG have consistently expanded our market presence nationwide through strategic partnerships and alliances, delivering a portfolio of high-quality and premium vehicles into the African market. We prioritize customer satisfaction and strive to exceed expectations. Our dedication to quality, innovation, and growth remains unwavering as we continue to shape the automotive industry landscape in Nigeria and beyond.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



1.) Executive Assistant and Project Supervisor

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Job Type: Full-time
Industry: Automotive

Job Summary


	The Executive Assistant and Project Supervisor to the Chief Operating Officer (COO) provides high-level administrative, analytical, and project management support to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the COO’s office.
	The role requires a detail-oriented, data-savvy, and highly organized professional capable of managing multiple priorities, tracking project deliverables, analyzing reports, and ensuring seamless coordination across departments.


Key Responsibilities
Executive and Office Management:


	Manage and maintain the COO’s calendar, appointments, and daily schedule to ensure effective time management.
	Prepare, review, and organize reports, presentations, and correspondence for the COO’s meetings and briefings.
	Coordinate and document meetings, including preparing agendas, taking minutes, and tracking action items.
	Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information and handle all matters with professionalism and discretion.


Operational, Analytical, and Project Management Support:


	Analyze operational data, track performance metrics, and generate insightful reports to support decision-making.
	Support the preparation of performance dashboards, business insights, and strategic presentations.
	Manage and track the progress of key projects and initiatives across departments, ensuring timely execution and alignment with organizational goals.
	Coordinate project timelines, deliverables, and stakeholder communications to ensure effective follow-up and accountability.
	Liaise with internal teams to collect and organize information for management reports, operational reviews, and project updates.


Strategic Support and Coordination:?


	Assist in the planning and execution of departmental goals and strategic initiatives.
	Monitor progress of key operational activities and provide regular updates to the COO.
	Anticipate the COO’s needs and provide proactive administrative, analytical, and project management support.


Requirements


	Proven experience in an executive-level support role, ideally within a large or multinational organization.
	Strong project management skills, with the ability to coordinate multiple work-streams and ensure timely delivery of outcomes.
	Experience using project management tools or frameworks (e.g., Asana, Trello, MS Project, or similar).
	Strong analytical and reporting skills with proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.
	Confidence in liaising with senior directors, stakeholders, and their executive assistants.
	Flexible, composed, and effective under varying workloads and tight deadlines.
	Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
	Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
	Initiative-driven, collaborative, and emotionally intelligent.
	Committed to confidentiality and handling of sensitive information.
	Analytical thinker with a problem-solving mindset.
	Detail-oriented with excellent proofreading and document preparation skills.
	Keen to understand business context and strategic implications of tasks.


Benefits


	Competitive Salary
	13th Month Allowance
	Leave Allowance
	Monthly Performance Bonus
	Retirement Savings
	Medical Coverage
	Opportunity to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment


Click here to apply online

 

2.) Head, Lagride Academy

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Job Type: Full-time
Industry: Transportation

Job Summary


	We are seeking a competent and visionary Head of Lagride Academy to lead all training, onboarding, and professional development initiatives for Lagride Captains.
	The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker and strong leader with a passion for human development, operational structure, and quality delivery.
	This position requires a proactive and result-oriented professional capable of building a training institution that produces well-trained, responsible, and service-driven Captains.


Key Responsibilities


	Strategic Leadership: Provide strategic direction and oversight for the Academy’s operations, ensuring alignment with Lagride’s mission and mobility objectives.
	Training Development: Design, implement, and monitor driver training programs focused on professionalism, safety, customer service, and technology usage.
	Curriculum Management: Develop and continuously update training modules, ensuring they meet industry standards and operational realities.
	Staff Supervision: Lead and coordinate a team of instructors, training officers, and administrative staff to deliver efficient and impactful sessions.
	Performance Monitoring: Track and evaluate trainee progress, ensuring readiness before deployment into active service.
	Stakeholder Collaboration: Partner with HR, Operations, and Technical Units to ensure training outcomes directly improve service quality and operational performance.
	Compliance & Certification: Ensure all training programs meet regulatory and company standards, issuing certificates to qualified Captains.
	Reporting: Prepare periodic reports on training performance, driver readiness, and Academy impact for management review.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Education, Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related discipline.
	Minimum of 7 years of professional experience, with at least 3 years in leadership or training management position.
	Proven experience in designing and managing large-scale training programs.
	Excellent leadership, presentation, and communication skills.
	Strong organizational and administrative capabilities.
	Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced operational environment.
	Experience within the transportation, logistics, or e-hailing industry is a major advantage.


Key Competencies:


	Strategic Leadership and People Management
	Curriculum Development and Training Delivery
	Effective Communication and Presentation Skills
	Data-Driven Decision Making
	Team Collaboration and Result Orientation
	Integrity, Discipline, and Professionalism


Benefits


	Competitive salary and performance incentives.
	Opportunity to lead a flagship Academy within Nigeria’s growing e-hailing ecosystem.
	Exposure to innovative learning and development practices.
	A fulfilling role in shaping the next generation of professional drivers and brand ambassadors for Lagride.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) GM EV Sales & Charging Infrastructure Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full time

Job Summary


	The General Manager, EV Sales & Charging Infrastructure, will lead the strategic development, implementation, and growth of the company’s Electric Vehicle (EV) business and charging network operations.
	This role is responsible for driving EV sales performance, expanding charging infrastructure across key locations, managing partnerships, and ensuring the company remains a market leader in Nigeria’s evolving e-mobility ecosystem.


Key Responsibilities:
Strategy and Business Development:


	Develop and implement a comprehensive EV sale and charging infrastructure strategy aligned with the company’s long-term vision for sustainable mobility.
	Identify business opportunities, partnerships, and government collaborations to expand EV adoption and charging networks.
	Drive initiatives that strengthen the company’s position as a leader in the EV market.


Sales and Market Growth:


	Lead nationwide EV sales operations, achieving revenue and market share targets.
	Oversee the development and execution of marketing campaigns, pricing strategies, and dealer network support for EV products.
	Monitor market trends, consumer behavior, and competitor activities to inform business decisions.


Charging Infrastructure Management:


	Plan, design, and oversee the rollout of EV charging stations in strategic urban and intercity locations.
	Collaborate with technical, engineering, and facility teams to ensure efficiency, safety, and reliability of charging infrastructure.
	Establish partnerships with public and private stakeholders for shared charging access and expansion.


Partnerships and Stakeholder Engagement:


	Engage with government agencies, regulators, and power distribution companies to align with national EV policies and incentives.
	Build relationships with real estate developers, fleet operators, and logistics companies for network expansion.
	Represent the company in industry forums and sustainability events.


Team Leadership and Performance Management:


	Lead and mentor a cross-functional team across EV sales, infrastructure operations, and customer support.
	Set performance goals, monitor KPIs, and ensure continuous capability development.
	Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and accountability within the EV division.


Financial and Operational Oversight:


	Develop and manage annual budgets for EV sales and charging operations.
	Track financial performance and ensure profitability of EV business lines.
	Ensure operational efficiency and compliance with safety, environmental, and technical standards.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business Administration, Marketing, or related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.
	Minimum of 10 years of experience in the automobile, energy, or mobility sector, with at least 5 years in senior management.
	Proven track record in EV sales, infrastructure development, or sustainable mobility projects.
	Strong understanding of EV technologies, power systems, and mobility solutions.
	Excellent leadership, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills.


Key Competencies:


	Strategic and analytical thinking.
	Business development and commercial acumen.
	Strong leadership and people management.
	Stakeholder and partnership management.
	Financial planning and budgeting.
	Project management and operational efficiency.
	Deep understanding of EV market trends and charging technologies.


Benefits


	Competitive Salary.
	13th Month Allowance.
	Leave Allowance.
	Monthly Performance Bonus.
	Retirement Savings.
	Medical Coverage.
	Group Life Insurance.
	Opportunity to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
